![Jamsil Hangang Park (ÌïúÍ∞ïÏãúÎØºÍ≥µÏõê Ïû†Ïã§ÏßÄÍµ¨(Ïû†Ïã§ÌïúÍ∞ïÍ≥µÏõê))](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/1567879_image2_1.webp) ## Overview > Jamsil Hangang Park is located on the southern side of the river between Jamsilcheolgyo Bridge and Yeongdong Bridge. The park is adjacent to Jamsil Sports Complex, Lotte World, and Olympic Park, and there are a variety of sports & cultural facilities located in the park.

The nature experience field created within the park is the perfect place for fieldtrips as well as family picnics. One of the biggest features of the Jamsil Hangang Park is the fishway in the Jamsil Water Reserve. Not only is it a great place to appreciate the beauty of the Hangang River, but it is also a place where visitors can learn more about nature through the diversity of eco-programs offered here. Near the fishway is a themed park equipped with wind vanes, walking paths, and underwater plant islets which serve as a resting place for fish. From Riverview Bom, a lookout caf√© located on Jamsil Bridge, you may enjoy the fantastic night view of the Hangang River. ## Intro | | | | - | - | |infocenter:|‚Ä¢ 1330 Travel Hotline: +82-2-1330
(Korean, English, Japanese, Chinese)

[Convenience facilities] Convenience store, restaurant, drinking fountain, shade pavillion, bike rack, nature experience site, Jamsil Bridge lookout caf√© | |Restrooms:|Available| ## Detail Image ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/1567878_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/1567878_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530710_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530710_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530715_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530715_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530716_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530716_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530839_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530839_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530842_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530842_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530844_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2530844_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2531111_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2531111_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2531112_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/2531112_image2_1.webp) ![/2022-08-04-1659612764655/1567877_image2_1.webp](/2022-08-04-1659612764655/1567877_image2_1.webp) ## Contact - [‚òéÔ∏è+82-2-3780-0511](tel:+82237800511) - [üè†hangang.seoul.go.kr](http://hangang.seoul.go.kr/) ```googleMap latitude: 37.5176118752 longitude: 127.0867403283 title: 65, Hangaram-ro, Songpa-gu, Seoul ``` ## Directions [Subway]
Jamsillaru Station (Seoul Subway Line 2), Exit 3 or 4.

Or,
Jamsil Station (Seoul Subway Line 2), Exit 6.
Walk for approx. 1km towards Jamsildaegyo Bridge.

data.title: Jamsil Hangang Park (ÌïúÍ∞ïÏãúÎØºÍ≥µÏõê Ïû†Ïã§ÏßÄÍµ¨(Ïû†Ïã§ÌïúÍ∞ïÍ≥µÏõê))
data.description:
Jamsil Hangang Park is located on the southern side of the river between Jamsilcheolgyo Bridge and Yeongdong Bridge. The park is adjacent to Jamsil Sports Complex, Lotte World, and Olympic Park, and there are a variety of sports & cultural facilities located in the park.

The nature experience field created within the park is the perfect place for fieldtrips as well as family picnics. One of the biggest features of the Jamsil Hangang Park is the fishway in the Jamsil Water Reserve. Not only is it a great place to appreciate the beauty of the Hangang River, but it is also a place where visitors can learn more about nature through the diversity of eco-programs offered here. Near the fishway is a themed park equipped with wind vanes, walking paths, and underwater plant islets which serve as a resting place for fish. From Riverview Bom, a lookout caf√© located on Jamsil Bridge, you may enjoy the fantastic night view of the Hangang River.
data.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namsan Octagonal Pavilion (ÎÇ®ÏÇ∞ ÌåîÍ∞ÅÏ†ï)
dataList.description: Originally known as Unamjeong Pavilion, the pavilion was built in 1959 to commemorate Rhee Syngman. It was demolished by the 4.19 movement in 1960 and was rebuilt on November 11, 1968. This pavilion now sits atop Namsan Mountain, with views covering the entirety of Seoul below. As it is a prime spot to view the first sunrise of the year, the annual sunrise festival takes place every New Year's Day.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Namsan Cable Car (ÎÇ®ÏÇ∞ ÏºÄÏù¥Î∏îÏπ¥)
dataList.description: Namsan Cable Car provides a panoramic view of downtown Seoul. The cable car has been in operation for over 40 years, taking tourists and residents alike to Namsan Seoul Tower, one of the most representative tourist attractions in the city.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Nakseonjae Hall (ÎÇôÏÑ†Ïû¨)
dataList.description:
Located inside Changdeokgung Palace, Nakseonjae Hall is a one-story structure built in ikgong style (bird wing-shaped eaves placed on top of the pillars) with a hip tiled and gable roof. It has 6 kan in the front and 2 kan (traditional unit of measurement of the space between pillars) to the sides. It originally belonged to the nearby Changgyeonggung Palace, but came to be considered a part of Changdeokgung Palace in more recent years.

The hall was constructed in 1846 (12th year of King Heonjong‚Äôs reign) and it is collectively called Nakseonjae together with the adjacent Seokbokheon Hall and Sugangjae Hall.

Behind the building is a flower garden made of stacked large stones. The chimney, the flowers, and the oddly shaped stones harmoniously blend into one another to create an outstanding landscape gardening.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Naksan Park (ÎÇôÏÇ∞Í≥µÏõê)
dataList.description: Naksan Park gets its name from its camel hump-like appearance. The mountain is a solid granite bedrock. The Joseon royal family enjoyed the natural beauty of the granite mountain, but during the Japanese Colonial Period, a hasty manner of urban planning resulted in the demolition of most parts of the mountain.  In an effort to save the remaining green belts, Naksan was designated as a park on June 10, 2002.  Located in the center of the Seoul, this historical and beautiful park allows its visitors to view the magnificence of the entire city.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: N. Olive Esthetic (Ïï§Ïò¨Î¶¨Î∏å ÏóêÏä§ÌÖåÌã±)
dataList.description: Located on the first underground floor of Times Square in Yeongdeungpo, N. Olive Esthetic is a spa and beauty care shop. It offers professional nail art, hand and foot care and skin and full body therapies. Services include specialty packages like the Oil Candle Therapy (aroma oil produced from melted candles) using beauty care items from France. Every service includes a foot massage.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Myogaksa Temple-Seoul (Î¨òÍ∞ÅÏÇ¨ (ÏÑúÏö∏))
dataList.description: Located east of Naksan Mountain at Sungin-dong, Jongno-gu in Seoul, Myogaksa Temple offers the urbanites a chance to experience Temple Stay. Since 2002, Myogaksa Temple has run its special Temple Stay program titled ‚ÄúFree from All Anxiety‚Äù, which sees a growing number of foreign participants every year. Moreover, you may also have a chance to experience Korean traditional culture as well as get to know Korean history better through interesting stories.
dataList.author: korea-tour

dataList.title: Myeongdong Cathedral (ÏÑúÏö∏ Î™ÖÎèôÏÑ±Îãπ)
dataList.description:
Myeongdong Cathedral is the Church for Archdiocese of Seoul and was also the birthplace for the Roman Catholic Church community in Korea. The church houses the remains of several individuals Bishop Laurent Joseph Marie Imbert (1796-1839), and priests Peter Simon (1803-1839), James (Jacques Honor Chastan, 1803-1839) and Pourthie Jean Antoine Charles (1830-1866) and four martyrs.

Myeongdong Cathedral is located in downtown Seoul and tourists frequently come and visit the place. Near the cathedral are other tourism spots such as Namsangol Hanok Village preserving Korean traditional houses, N Seoul Tower overlooking Seoul and Namdaemun Market, a traditional market with a wide variety of food and goods.
dataList.author: korea-tour
